properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Gaujas (Tirziņas ieteka)
properties.txt: Picnic and camping place near the river Gauja. There is a sheltered table, fire place, lots of space for tents.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Gaujas tilta Strenči
Atpūtas vieta pie Gaujas tilta Strenči
Atpūtas vieta pie Janopoles dīķa
properties.txt: A pleasant and nicely equipped picnic and tenting place near a small pond. Road is nearby, but does not disturb much. Pleasant and recommended.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Kaļņa ezera
properties.txt: A resting place near a forest lake, a nice place popular with local people who come here for a swim, or to spend the day.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Kaļņa ezera
properties.txt: A picnic area near a forest lake, with a small sheltered table

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Kaļņa ezera
properties.txt: A picnic area near the Kalna lake, there is a wooden structure with a table too, to save yourself from rain.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Kapu ezera
properties.txt: A nice lake with a wide and open space to build tents. Possible to swim, have a picnic. The area is close to the nearby settlement, so expect locals having fun and listening to music.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Kaupēna ezera
properties.txt: A picnic place nearby a lake, just beside a road. There are all the necessities, a table with a roof, toilets, fire pit with grill and hooks. Plenty of space for tents too.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Klievezera
properties.txt: A picnic and beach area in the Smiltene city. This is more of a rest stop with swimming opportunity, than a tent place, although there is nothing to stop you from camping here if the other nearby (better) spots are all taken.

properties.name: Adamovas taka
properties.txt: The path is making loops and turns, there are a few bridges and duckboards, nice sloped forests. You can see views of the Daugava river and the Kraslava city.

properties.name: Aklā purva taka
properties.txt: A new duckboard in the Akla (Blind) mire. To arrive by car, you have to take the road from the western side. The road is narrow and can get muddy, so maybe leave the car and walk. There are a few benches along the path, but no tables.

properties.name: Akmeņupes dabas taka
properties.txt: An old and overgrown path, but does have a few new picnic tables. There are no signs, so following the trail in it's entirety can be hard. We did not find it at one point, so had to turn back.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Lašupes dzirnavu dīķa
properties.txt: A nice place near a pond, there is a sheltered picnic table, a fire pit, the place is maintained and pleasant. A little secluded too.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Lielā Svētiņu ezera
properties.txt: A nice lake with a picnic place, benches and a fireplace. Simple to reach by car, but very remote and secluded. Pleasant. Can build a tent or many.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Meistara ezera (Malstara ezers)
Atpūtas vieta pie Pātraža ezera
properties.txt: A picnic place near a forest lake. There is a sheltered table, fire place, access to the lake with a small pier. The place is nice and kept clean.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Pīļezera
properties.txt: Several resting places near a lake, surounded by forests. Appropriate to take a swim. A few simple tables in several places. Not very romantic, but good enough for a quick stop, meal and swim.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Šostu ezera
properties.txt: A nice place near a forest lake. There is a picnic booth, a fire pit and space for tents. Very pleasant and recommended.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Vārmes
properties.txt: A table with benches near a pond. Not very pleasant, the table is old, the place is open and near a road. Maybe a place to eat your sandwitch and stretch your legs, while passing by, nothing more. If no nicer alternatives, can build tents here.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta pie Vorcu ezera
properties.txt: Near a forest gravel road, a small picnic place with a few new tables. The old ones are being used as firewood right now. A small access place to the lake, so you can have a swim too.  Possible to find a place for tent as well.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta piecu ceļu krustā
properties.txt: A picnic place with several tables and a fire pit, near the intersection of five forest roads. The roads are not very active.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Piļkas
properties.txt: A rest area in the crossroads of some forest roads. The place is ok, but there is no table and no toilet, only a shelter, fire place, and some places for tents. Not a spectacular place, but maybe for a quick overnight sleep is fine.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Priežu mežs
properties.txt: A resting place in a forest. There is a huge, recently built table with a roof, a fire pit and other niceties.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Restorāns
properties.txt: A big picnic house with several tables, located on the crossroads of straight forest roads. Not a pleasant place, looks as if mostly hunters use it. In desperate situation you can eat here or pitch a tent, but the more logical step would be to go to the nearby Lubana lake.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Riebiņu ezers
properties.txt: A picnic place near Riebinu lake, more something of a swimming place, there is a dressing booth and the tables are pretty old, looks like local people visit this place often for swimming.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Rozēnu tilts
properties.txt: A well equipped picnic and camping spot near the Salaca river. You can pitch tents, there are two tables near eachother at the side of the road. The tent you can also build near the river itself, but there isn't plenty of space. A wider area is located in a meadow near the road. Not spectacular, but good enough.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Šūpoles
properties.txt: An old picnic place in a forest, table is in bad condition and the place is run down, but can be used as a last resort tenting place.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Tīteņi Steķu silā
properties.txt: A picnic place located at a small forest lake, very secluded, can drive up from the north direction (see map). The equipment is old, but the table and benches are usable.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Vasas
properties.txt: A huge free campground not far from the Tuja village. Has tables, fireplaces, toilets plenty of room for tents. The place is right on the beach, the individual spots are not physically separated, but since the territory is very big, there is no overcrowding. The only negative aspect could be that since this is a popular spot, there are always other campers and some of them might be noisy at night. Place is not managed or guarded, but is an official campground owned by state forest service. There are smaller picnic sites nearby this one, but we count them all as one area.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Vecvietas
properties.txt: A beautiful and well equipped picnic spot at the Salaca river. You can build tents, there are four separate picnic spots with tables, grill places, toilets, even firewood. An excellent location, easily accessible from the road or the river.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Ventmala
properties.txt: Resting place at the Venta river, quite a way from the road, have to drive over a muddy forest road, which could be difficult in bad weather. In summer it is easier and the place is very wide and has a nice view. The amenities are old and there is a better picnic place near the bridge in Nigrande

properties.name: Ako piemiņas vieta
properties.txt: A big meadow with lots of space, but quite popular due to easy access to the river.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Akmens
properties.txt: A very secluded and hard to reach place, but pleasant and wide enough to have place for many tents. There is even a brick fireplace and a picnic house here. The river Iča is nearby, but it is very narrow and grown in, hard to even find it.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Bārtas upes krastā
properties.txt: A resting place near the river Barta. There is a toilet, tables, overall a pleasant place. It is possible to reach it by car, from the western direction (Laukgals hamlet), accessible also from north (Kiburu road).

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Karogu karjers
properties.txt: A wonderful place on an island in an artificial lake. There are several picnic spots and a short trail to the Dzelzamurs stone. There are clean toilets provided.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Ķēķis
properties.txt: An old picnic place, nearly falling apart. A few benches and a fire place, located nearby two forest roads, nothing particularly interesting.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Pie dīķa
properties.txt: A wonderful location in the middle of a forest, near a small artificial pond, suitable for swimming. There are two sheltered picnic tables. A very pleasant place to relax and spend the night in a tent.

properties.name: Dziļezera-Riebezera taka
properties.txt: The trail makes a circle around one of the two lakes, over a narrow stretch of ground that separates them.

properties.name: Egļukalna skatu tornis
properties.txt: Currently closed! (A great view from this high tower, when it was open)

properties.name: Ēkāju ozols
properties.txt: A camping spot near a huge oak. There is a table, swings for children. You could pitch tents here without issue. The wooden equipment is old and there is a quarry nearby, so we can't recommend this for a special trip. Good only if passing by.

properties.name: Engures ezera atpūtas vietas
properties.txt: Several picnic tables in the marked spot and to the south along the lake. Fire pit, toilets, plenty of room for tents as well. Don't miss the Orchid trail and birdwatching tower through the Ornithology base (free access).

properties.name: Engures ezera putnu tornis
properties.txt: A birdwatching tower in the Engure ornithology base. Free access, you can walk the Orchid trail on the way to the tower.

properties.name: Engures ezera Z tornis
properties.txt: A newly built birdwatching tower inside a boating base. A private territory, so not really clear how much you can do here without renting a boat.

properties.name: Gārsenes parks
properties.txt: Around the river of Dienvidsuseja, near the Garsene casle, a whole system of short trails has been made. There are many camping and picnic places, including fire pits and a boat rental. We suggest you to start from the Garsene castle, where a ticket must be purchased.

properties.name: Imulas upes taka
properties.txt: Imula flows into the river of Abava, it is a curved and steep coasted river. The length of this trail is around 5km and it will lead you until the Buse mound. The trail is badly marked and pretty overgrown, you will have to use the map to follow it. In the beginning there is a nice resting place and parking

properties.name: Jāņupītes taka
properties.txt: A nice forest trail. Suggested approach is from the north side, near the Dreimani homestead. There is a "private property" sign, but you can safely pass that, as there is no other way to get here.

properties.name: Jušu dabas taka
properties.txt: An interesting trail for children. They will have to find small pictures of the imaginary forest spirits. The trail starts near Sigulda castle. There is parking and toilets. Trail goes through a forested area and can sometimes be difficult to follow, use the map to follow the marked route.

properties.name: Kalnu dabas taka
properties.txt: This trail was opened in 2015. and is built by locals with assistance from various funds. The trail follows the Losis river, which is nice and picturesque at times. There are several nice picnic places along the way. The trail provides signs for a guessing game for kids in latvian language.

properties.name: Kaltenes kalvas
properties.txt: In the forest, some one and a half kilometers from Kaltene beach, you will find interesting rock piles, which are called "Kalvas". These uniquie formations are the only such things in the whole Latvian coastline. The trail will show you around them.

properties.name: Kaltenes putnu tornis
properties.txt: A birdwatching tower at the Kaltene bird trail. The trail itself is so old that you can barely follow it, although there is a new toilet at the free parking. We have placed the waypoint at the tower itself.

properties.name: Kamparkalna skatu tornis
properties.txt: This very high tower is located in the highest place of Northern Kurland, the hill called Kamparkalns.

properties.name: Kaņiera pilskalna taka
properties.txt: A loop trail near the Kaniera lake, around 2.5km long, plenty of informational boards on the way. There is a birdwatching tower on the way. Fire is not permitted officially, although somebody has made an illegal fire pit near the tower picnic place. No toilet

properties.name: Kaņiera niedrāja taka
properties.txt: A nice floating duckboard walk between the islands of the Kaniera lake. The trail is mounted on floating mounts, so you are walking on water - a very pleasant feeling. Plenty of different birds here and a wonderful view from the birdwatching tower.

properties.name: Kaņiera pilskalna tornis
properties.txt: A birdwatching tower at the Kaniera lake

properties.name: Kartavkalna taka
properties.txt: A wide territory with more than one walking path, several nice picnic places and a fire pit. There is a replica of an old latvian castle built here. The name "Kartavkalns" comes from latvian "The Hanging mound".

properties.name: Lielā Ķemeru tīreļa laipa
properties.txt: Most probably the most popular mire trail in Latvia, recently rebuilt. This is the first boarded trail that got peoples attention, most likely because of the vicinity to the capital. Parking is 2EUR, toilets available.

properties.name: Pēteralas Raganu katla taka
properties.txt: The trail leads to several places, stops at Petera cave and leads to the Witches cauldron, a geological formation. The trail has several route options, is well marked and contains lots of stairs. Very icy in the winter, so we suggest to visit in warmer time.

properties.name: Pēterezera taka
properties.txt: The start of the trail leads through a pine forest, later becomes narrower and can get steep, so stroller is not recoomended for the most part. There are many wooden bridges and wooden plank trails, so the trail shows quite a lot of different biotopes. There is a swamp lake on the way. A nice trail overall.

properties.name: Pilskalnes Siguldiņa
properties.txt: A broad territory of many trails of different lenghts, an information center and beautiful lakes. Each trail has a different theme - the dendrology trail, the war bunker trail, the views trail etc. Entrance is 2.5EUR

properties.name: Planču purva taka
properties.txt: The Plancu bog trail is a short wooden plank trail with information boards written in Braille, and is also modified with a non-slippery surface to help people with special needs.

properties.name: Plieņciema taka
properties.txt: A shiors duckboard trail leads to the beach, where you will find a picnic place with tables and a toilet. A nice place to access the beach, but possibly it's too close to the nearby village, as it's often quite messy.

properties.name: Plostu sienamā vieta
properties.txt: A resting place near Gauja, the official name is "Raft lashing place". There are no tables and the place is quite dark, not very pleasant. We don't recommend it for picnics or tents.

properties.name: Pokaiņu mežs
properties.txt: All kinds of rock formations and piles around which there are many walking trails in the woods. The wood is silent and pleasant, even ignoring the supposed history of the rocks.

properties.name: Priedaines skatu tornis
properties.txt: The second highest wooden viewing tower in Latvia is 32 meters tall. There is a nice picnic place available, and a bicycle route goes past it ("Saulkrastu trail", 8km long). A fire pit is also available.

properties.name: Pūrciema baltās kāpas taka
properties.txt: The Purciema Dune is 20 meters high. This wooden plank trail will bring you around the biggest of the dunes. The trail is 900 meters long, but is a pleasant walk and is recommended to stop here, if you do pass by. Free parking.

properties.name: Purezera taka
properties.txt: A wonderful wooden path, in the beginning you go through a nice old forest and then make a circle around a small lake. There are nice picnic spots on the lake, with fire pits right on top of the water.

properties.name: Ragakāpas dabas taka
properties.txt: A wooden walking path near the sea, leads among the pine forested dunes. Possibility to park for free and in general an interesting place to visit the sea in a less crowded place.

properties.name: Raipala ezera taka
properties.txt: The trail goes past the Trumulisa and Ieva lakes, and then circles the Raipala lake, one of Latvias deepest lakes (36 meters). It is possible to make the walk shorter, by cutting back after the first lake and returning to Korneti. The trail is marked.

properties.name: Randatu taka
properties.txt: A short trail that starts near the Luiku home and continues along the Gauja river. There are dolomite outcrops and plenty of nice views. There is a small resting place near the river and a car parking spot at the trailhead.

properties.name: Remtes parks
properties.txt: A nice park for walks, near the Remte manor.

properties.name: Riežupes dabas parks
properties.txt: A picnic area in the Riezupa nature park, near the river

properties.name: Romeškalna taka
properties.txt: This trail connects the Romeslalns school and the Korneti town. This trail will show you views from the Liepinu house to the Korulu lake, and from the Legeni hill to the Korneti valley. Near the Vosvu farm you will find an ancient site - the Gods hill and the Mara stone. Along the way you will also see one of the biggest stones in the area - the Sipinu stone. The trail is marked with yellow triangles and white signs.

properties.name: Salaspils pludmale
properties.txt: The beach near Salaspils has plenty of picnic tables, a childrens playground, swimming locations. The picnic spots have fire pits and the area is quite nice overall. Recently built. I would not say this is a place for tents, but some place to stop when passing by, to each lunch and stretch your legs. Maybe tenting is possible when no other options, because place is quite public.

properties.name: Sasaļu mežs
properties.txt: Picnic places near the Sasaļu lake. There are three swimming spots, the middle locations has a better table. This is a protected area with several important habitats and a eutrophic lake.

properties.name: Saukas ezers
properties.txt: A nice picnic and camping place near the Sauka lake (Saukas ezers), a perfect place to pitch tents. There are tables, a fire pit and good access to the lake for swimming or for a boat ride, if you take one with you. The place is not near a big road, so there should be no disturbance at night.

properties.name: Saulrieta taka
properties.txt: This 3.6km long walk from the White dune to Peterupe is mostly on the beach and in the seaside dunes. It is possible to walk futher until Zvejniekciems village or as far as you desire, since most of the trail is unmarked and follows the coast.

properties.name: Atpūtas vietas pie Niedrāja ezera
properties.txt: Several wonderful resting places around a forest lake, most of them nicely equipped with tables, firepits, grills, firewood and toilets. Some have nice swimming features and small piers with benches to enjoy the wonderful views. Highly recommended.

properties.name: Augstrozes pilskalns
properties.txt: A pleasant place that was recently renovated. You can stop here to see a castle mound with some ruins, a nice view, a short trail on the top and a small picnic spot. Photos before renovation.

properties.name: Baļotes ezers
properties.txt: A nice beach near the Balote lake, good picnic tables, fire pits, toilet, parking. A pleasant place for tents with access to the lake.

properties.name: Bebru taka
properties.txt: A quite short trail in a forested area, with several activities for children. A little overgrown, has a few picnic spots, but not worth a special trip. Only if you need to stretch your legs when passing by.

properties.name: Bezdibeņa ezera taka
properties.txt: A nice but short swamp trail near the Bezdibena lake (translated as Abyss). The trail is made of wooden planks, which have degraded over time, so it is in need of repairs and might be difficult with a stroller.

properties.name: Cecīļu dabas taka
properties.txt: The Cecilu trail will allow you to visit the Amata, Kumada and Dancu rivers and other nature sights in the region.

properties.name: Ceļa mala
properties.txt: An older picnic site near a road, not much room for a tent, but you can stop to have a meal here.

properties.name: Cenas tīreļa laipa
properties.txt: A wonderful swamp trail nearby the capital. There are toilets, picnic tables, information boards and a few birdwatching towers

properties.name: Ciriša ezera upursalas taka
properties.txt: The trail is located on an island in the Cirisa lake. You can rent a boat from one of the houses nearby, if you ask around. If you have your own boat, the best place to start is behind the Aglona bandstand, where you will find a pleasant rest place and beach. The trail itself is very diverse and worth visiting. There are picnic places on the island.

properties.name: Čužu purva taka
properties.txt: A 3km trail, of which 700m is made from wooden planks as it crosses a small bog. Has wonderful picnic places near a river, with a fire pit and even a sulfur spring on the way.

properties.name: Dabas lieguma Dunika skābaržu audze
properties.txt: A damp, dark and overgrown place, which can basically be used for parking the car and walking to the Dunika duckboard trail. The trail starts behind the picnic table, don't get lost - the trail is not near the sign. That just leads you into the deep forest.

properties.name: Dabas parks Laukezers
properties.txt: One of the purest lakes in Latvia, the Laukezers lakes is a protected area. There is a big parking area near a short boardwalk, which leads to the beach area. There is a dressing booth, a fire place with a grill. There is an icon on the info board, that tenting is not allowed, although there is plenty of room for this. A clean and nice toilet is available near the parking area.

properties.name: Daugavgrīvas mols
properties.txt: Not a proper trail, but a nice walk on the beach. The waypoint will bring you to a car parking where you can start your walk towards the Daugavgriva lighthouse. You can see sand dunes, old soviet buildings, WW1 bunkers and many other things on the way.

properties.name: Driksnis
properties.txt: The Driksnis lake picnic spot is a little shaded, has a picnic booth with a table, also has a table outside. There is a small pier to enjoy the view or swim. Toilet is provided.

properties.name: Drusku pilskalna taka
properties.txt: An interesting trail leading to the Drusku mound, which is one of the steepest mounds in Latvia.

properties.name: Dunduru pļavu tornis
properties.txt: A birdwatching tower in the the Dunduri meadows, which surround the Slampe river, now restored to it's original path, after straightening in the soviet times. You can see wild cows here.

properties.name: Dunikas purva taka
properties.txt: A long duckboard trail over the Dunika mire. The route is several kilometers long, and goes in one direction, meaning you will have to retrace your steps back. In the middle of the mire you will find a unique hornbeam thicket (at south end of the trail). Can start from either end of trail.

properties.name: Zaņas līkloči
properties.txt: An old and unkept trail along the Zana river.

properties.name: Žibgravas veselības taka
properties.txt: This trail is located near the Zibgrava ravine and the Kaulina river. There is a picnic spot at the start of the trail.

properties.name: Ziemeļgaujas skatu tornis
properties.txt: A new, very tall tower, opened in 2015, shows the surrounding forests and a little bit of Gauja river.

properties.name: Žīguri
properties.txt: A covered picnic table, a fire pit and some other extras, but since this place is very near a populated place, it is very popular with local teens, so most likely you will find plenty of trash and unexpected party people in the middle of the night. Better visit the nearby Pond location (see map).

properties.name: Zīles taka
properties.txt: The trail begins in the hamlet of Zile, the trail goes through an old forest with many fallen branches and thick, mossy trees. There are many information boards, bridges and a picnic place at the furthest point.

properties.name: Zilo kalnu kraujas tornis
properties.txt: A viewing platform near the Zilo kalnu (Blue hills) steep, right next to the highway from Dundaga to Mazirbe. A nice view, you can see the sea.

properties.name: Ziloņa ezers
properties.txt: Several picnic tables around the Zilona lake. A few have just a table, but others have a roof over it. Nice views on the lake. The best table is between the lakes and the one on the north shore.

properties.name: Ķengaraga putnu tornis
properties.txt: A nice place to have an evening walk right in the city. Views of Daugava river, benches and a long promenade. The birdwatching tower is located in an area where lots of birds flock, especially in the winter. Free parking.

properties.name: Ķirbižu meža taka
properties.txt: An interesting forest trail, looks like not many people have visited it. Many old trees and a feeling of an old forest. Can park near the Forest museum.

properties.name: Kokneses dabas taka
properties.txt: The trail starts near the Koknese church, where you can leave your car. On the way there are several resting places with fire pits, but no benches. Koknese has plenty to offer, don't miss the castle ruins and the parks. This particular trail leads to the Liktendarzs (Destiny garden), so altogether you can make this a whole day walk.

properties.name: Kokšu ezera taka
properties.txt: Not really a trail, more of a forest route with no special trail, only arrows marking the suggested direction. You can see several forest lakes and a typical Latvian forest habitat. The lakes have nice picnic places.

properties.name: Kolkas priežu taka
properties.txt: A nice stroll though beautiful pines near the sea. The trail ends at a big viewing tower. The free parking has plenty of space so you can explore the area. There are big and comfortable toilets at the start of the trail, one of them wheelchair accessible

properties.name: Kolkas putnu tornis
properties.txt: A high observation tower in Kolka. Free parking and toilets nearby.

properties.name: Kristakrūga tornis
properties.txt: A very high metallic viewing tower in the Teiči nature reserve. Nothing much else here, just a huge tower, recently built, located at the side of a highway.

properties.name: Krustkalnu skatu tornis
properties.txt: A very high metallic viewing tower in the Krustkalni nature reserve. Nothing much else here, just a huge tower.

properties.name: Kubeseles dabas taka
properties.txt: A nice walk where you can see forests, caves, streams and the river Gauja. Parking is free, near the church. Trail begins behind the church buildings, walk down the long stairway and turn left after the tiny bridge.

properties.name: Kupskalnu dabas taka
properties.txt: A very short walk to the beach, free parking and good for a stroller. The view to the Riga bay is wonderful here.

properties.name: Lāčupes dendroloģiskā taka
properties.txt: An interesting walk near a small stream. Could be hard to find, because there is no sign to it, and there is a distracting bigger trail that leads to the beach. Follow our map. The Dendrarium contains many foreing trees and bushes.

properties.name: Lejas ezera atpūtas vieta
properties.txt: A picnic place at the Lejas lake, possibility to make a fire and pitch a tent.

properties.name: Līču Laņģu klintis
properties.txt: The Līču-Laņģu sanstone cliffs are around one kilometer long, and a stunning place to visit. The route is marked for around 6km, but options exist to shorten or extend your walk. Recommended to make a photo of the map on the first information board, it is detailed and good.

properties.name: Lielais liepu kalns ar skatu torni
properties.txt: The highest wooden tower in Latvia (34m) sits on top of the Lielais Liepu kalns (The Big Linden hill, literally). On the way to the tower you will walk on a 890m path with information boards and will see a few very nice picnic places with fire pits and tent places.

properties.name: Lielezera dabas taka
properties.txt: In the city of Limbazi there is a trail around the lake. On the way you will be able to visit a pleasant birdwatching tower, cross a reed field over a boardwalk and rest in the well maintained beach area.

properties.name: Liepājas ez. taka un tornis (Tisē iela)
properties.txt: A 400 meter long duckboard trail leads to the Birdwatching tower on the Liepaja lake. Since it is located in a city, it can get busy and some of the infrastructure is in bad shape already.

properties.name: Liepājas ez. Zirgu salas (Golodova) tornis
properties.txt: A birdwatching tower on the Horse island in Liepaja

properties.name: Līgatnes dabas takas
properties.txt: A free park with possibility to see different kind of latvian animals (not caged, but in wide fenced areas), walk in a forested area an eat pancakes in a low cost cafe. Gauja river is neaby too.

properties.name: Līgatnes upes taka
properties.txt: A trail through an old and beautiful forest near the Ligatne river. There are many interesting bridges and a magical feeling in the air. The trail can be steep and slippery. There are few nice picnic places on the way, including fire pits. To reach this place, follow the arrows that begin at the "Kigari" bus stop on the Nitaure highway.

properties.name: Ložmetējkalns
properties.txt: The Ložmetējkalns hill is located on one of the World War I battlefields. The high tower provides an overview of the surrounding forest.

properties.name: Lubāna piknika vietas un pludmale
properties.txt: A great place to rest and swim, a wide beach-like area, many picnic tables, parking, dressing cabins and a short walking trail.

properties.name: Lubāna putnu tornis
properties.txt: One of several birdwatching towers around the Lubana lake. The place is quite remote.

properties.name: Lubāna putnu tornis 2
properties.txt: One of several birdwatching towers around the Lubana lake. The place is quite remote.

properties.name: LVM atpūtas vieta
properties.txt: A nice picnic place with big tables under a roof, a fire pit. A quiet place, the nearby road does not have a lot of traffic. Possible to pitch a tent.

properties.name: Purva trase
properties.txt: A covered picnic table, a fire pit. The place is very remote and located at the end of a road that leads nowhere. There is no space for a tent here. Not really worth going all this way just to picnic here.

properties.name: Mālpils dabas taka
properties.txt: The trail begins at a huge oak tree, where you will find a toilet and a picnic place. The route takes you along the Merga river, the views are beautiful.

properties.name: Matuļu taka
properties.txt: The owners of the nearby farmstead, the Matulu family has made a trail for children, they have made several wood carvings and other objects that will give motivation for smaller children. There is also a playground and a resting place.

properties.name: Melnalkšņu dumbrāja taka
properties.txt: A short duckboard walk near the hedquarters of Ķemeri nature protection agency. The path is newly renovated and leads along some very interesting swamp habitat.

properties.name: Mērsrags - pļavas tornis
properties.txt: A new birdwatching tower on the beach in Mersrags.

properties.name: Meži ap Ādmiņa ezeru
properties.txt: A nice picnic place near a lake. Possible to park your car some 30 meters away, to reach the lake you must walk along a forest path. At the lake there is a covered picnic table, a fire pit and a small pier on the lake. Nearby there is a tiny stream where there once was a sluice, but now all that remains is a small waterfall.

properties.name: Mežmuižas avoti
properties.txt: A protected area where you will find a 700 meter long trail, there is a brook with excellent drinking water at the beginning. The entrance costs 1EUR but the territory is well maintained. Nice places for a picnic with excellent surroundings.

properties.name: Mīlestības taka
properties.txt: A nice trail near the Abuls river, starts at the Jaunaraji commercial camground. A good picnic spot is available on the way, near the river.

properties.name: Mitoloģiskā taka pie Līgatnes bunkura
properties.txt: A nice short walk that begins at the Ligatne soviet bunker and makes a loop along the Gauja river. There are wooden figures along the way, so children will also enjoy it.

properties.name: Niedrāju pilkas purvs
properties.txt: A nice 1.5km duckboard trail with a small birdwatching tower. A few beautiful mire lakes can be seen.

properties.name: Numernes vaļņa taka
properties.txt: The trail takes to you to see the Numerne Protected Area, a Nature 2000 territory. There is a viewing tower, a trail and a picnic spot. This protected area includes an esker with coniferous forests. Bog woodland and three lakes (Numerne, Vidus and Kugrinu lakes) are found next to the esker. Transitional mires have developed in Vidus and Kugrinu lakes.

properties.name: Ogres zilie kalni
properties.txt: A walking route begins here and leads over the Blue Hills of Ogre. There are a few information boards on the way, the route is quite long and does not follow one certain path. This is more likely to a park. You can bike here, since there are wide paths and no stairs. At the end of the route, there is a flooded quarry where locals swim, also a high viewing platform (tower).

properties.name: Ogres zilo kalnu tornis
properties.txt: A 30.5m high wooden tower at the Ogre blue hills. Nice views from the platform. Nearby is a nice place to have a swim.

properties.name: Oleru purva taka
properties.txt: The trail leads you though a forest and then through the Oleri mire. A viewing platform is also there. Site includes open transitional mire (Oleru Mire) formed by terrestrialization surrounded by pine dominated bog woodland. Fragmentary, dry coniferous forests are found.

properties.name: Oleru putnu tornis
properties.txt: A birdwatching tower near the Oleri nature trail

properties.name: Orhideju taka
properties.txt: Park your car at the end of the straight road, near the picnic places and the lake. To the right, enter the ornithology complex to visit wild cows and horses, see the Orchid trail and the birdwatching tower.

properties.name: Palsmanes piedzīvojumu taka
properties.txt: A circular tail around 2.2km long, with various optional routes, just follow the signs. The beginning is near a new information board at the Palsa river, near the bridge in Palsmane.

properties.name: Papes ezers
properties.txt: The Pape lake is a huge territory with many trails, birdwatching towers and other sites. Suggested to see the Pape website and visit the information center beforehand

properties.name: Papes putnu tornis
properties.txt: A birdwatching tower near the Pape lake

properties.name: Tilderu dabas taka
properties.txt: A short nature trail near the river Gauja. Has a few dolomite outcrops on the way. At the end of the trail, there are long stairs that lead down to the river, but there is no resting place.

properties.name: Sedas purva tornis
properties.txt: The Seda mire is an interesting area, with it's soviet style village and surroundings, it is worth a trip. The birdwatching towers are recently built and provide some of the best birdwatching options in the country. The game of towers ornithologist competition takes place here. The access to this tower is from the Jerceni village direction.

properties.name: Sedas purva tornis 2
properties.txt: The Seda mire is an interesting area, with it's soviet style village and surroundings, it is worth a trip. The birdwatching towers are recently built and provide some of the best birdwatching options in the country.

properties.name: Senču svētkalniņa atpūtas vieta
properties.txt: Near the Daugmales mound you will see a sign to the Ancestor Holy Mound. A nice place with tables, toilets, fireplaces, right next to river Daugava

properties.name: Sēravots pie Gaujas
properties.txt: A nice resting place near Gauja river, accessible both from the road and from the river. There is a small stream with fresh water coming from under a rock, suitable for drinking. Table, fire place, plenty of tent space.

properties.name: Sietiņiezis un taka
properties.txt: The Sietiņiezis cliff is made of white sandstone, the biggest in Latvia. You will find a picnic area and a few short walking paths in the area. Wonderful views of the Gauja river.

properties.name: Sigulda Līgatne
properties.txt: a 20.5km long one way route from Sigulda to the Ligatne nature trail complex. The route is marked with blue rhombs.

properties.name: Skaņākalna taka
properties.txt: A most wonderful trail along the Salaca river. You will see cliffs, caves, streams and forests. The trail is decorated with wooden carvings, children playgrounds and picnic spots. Since this is a maintained park, entry costs 1.5EUR per person or 5 EUR per car, but better leave the car at the ticket booth and walk along the small trail - the road is very boring.

properties.name: Šlīteres dabas taka
properties.txt: This trail starts at the Slitere lighhouse, which, curiously, is not located anywhere near the sea. The place is located inside the Slitere Nature Reserve, the highest protection status.

properties.name: Slokas ezera dabas taka
properties.txt: The trail starts at the Sloka lake birdwatching tower. The trail is pretty wet most of the year, so good boots required. At the end of the trail you will find a few wooden excercise installations for children.

properties.name: Slokas ezera putnu tornis
properties.txt: An easily accessible birdwatching tower, located right on the Sloka lake. The tower is small, but provides a good view of the area. An old walking trail is nearby.

properties.name: Smiltiņkalns
properties.txt: This is the highest point in the Eastern Kurland area, where you can ascend to a viewing  platform. There is a covered picnic table, benches and a fire place.

properties.name: Špakovska parks
properties.txt: The dendrologic park Lazdukalni, also known as the Spakovsky park contains more than 7000 plants, 412 species of trees and other garden varieties. There is a pond, a viewing platform and plenty of space to sit down and have a picnic.

properties.name: Stiglovas grava
properties.txt: This route will mostly appeal to those who appreciate unspoiled woods and grown in trails. The infrastructure is mostly gone and there are many bushes and weeds that you will have to overcome to follow this dark and shadowy trail. The Stiglova ravine is a good place to see the white and brown devon sandstone slopes and outcrops.

properties.name: Strenču pilsētas taka
properties.txt: Several walking routes 1-5.5km in length, there are picnic spots, a beautiful forest and of course the Gauja river

properties.name: Svētes piknika vieta
properties.txt: Picnic tables and a fire place near the Svete river

properties.name: Tālivalža grava
properties.txt: A trail with activity elements, a picnic place and a covered table. The trail is made by locals with help from foreign exchange students. The trail is quite old, so many elements have grown back into the forest which they were made from.

properties.name: Tērvetes dabas parks
properties.txt: A big territory with many activities, there is an information centre, several cafes, many playgrounds for children and all kinds of beautiful wooden carvings. Recommended for families with younger children

properties.name: Timsmales baltezers
properties.txt: Several nice picnic places near the Timsmales lake. Popular amongst the locals, so free spots could become available only in late hours. The lake is one of Latvias clearest lakes, made into a protected area due to abundance of the rare floating bur-reeds (also known as narrowleaf bur-reed)

properties.name: Tīrumnieku purva taka
properties.txt: A short, but beautiful trail that runs in a circular path, along a small swamp lake.

properties.name: Tolkāja tornis
properties.txt: The Teici nature reserve is the highest level of protective area. This tower is one of the few places where you are allowed to see it. A good place for birdwatching.

properties.name: Ūdenstūristu nakšņošanas vieta pie Pededzes
properties.txt: A resting place near the Pededze river, made by river tourists, but accessible by road. There is a fire place, firewood. The access to the river is very steep, lowering a boat would be difficult.

properties.name: Ūdru kalna skatu tornis
properties.txt: This is a 26.5m high tower with views to the Usma lake and it's islands. There is a short path that leads to the tower.

properties.name: Ukru gārša
properties.txt: The Ukru gārša is a proteted are more than 1135 hectares large, near Bukaiši and Ukri. A trail has been created to allow visitors to this site. The shortest route is 1550 meters. At the start of the trail, there is a spaceous picnic area with a picnic shelter, firepit, benches and plenty of space for tents. The trail starts across the road from the picnic area, parallel to the ditch.

properties.name: Ukru gāršas piknika vietas
properties.txt: A table, fire pit, an open space for tents. Neaby there is a nature trail. The Ukru forest is a protected area due to the old oaks it's unmaintained nature.

properties.name: Užavas bāka
properties.txt: A resting spot near the Uzava lighthouse

properties.name: Užavas grīvas taka
properties.txt: The trail starts at the Uzava river creek, there is a parking place and a camping spot with benches and a table for a picnic. You can build tents here as well. The Uzava river is one of the few places where you can observe unregulated river flow into the sea.

properties.name: Vaidavas dabas taka
properties.txt: The information boards along the Vaidava river will teach you about the valleys nature and history, as well as boating possibilities in the Vaidava river. The main objects of interest are located in the beginning of the route, the Ragana cliffs, the Raganina spring, the Acu spring. There are picnic places, a shelter, swings and a toilet.

properties.name: Valguma baskāju taka
properties.txt: The Baskāju trail (literally, the barefoot trail) is a special obstacle course, if you will, for walking barefoot. A fun experience and you even get to walk in white mud and through a river. The lenght is 2km and it costs 4EUR per person.

properties.name: Valguma dabas gleznu taka
properties.txt: This three kilometer walk brings you through a foresty area near the Valguma lake and the Slocene river. Starts inside a hotel complex, but access is free.

properties.name: Vasenieku purva taka
properties.txt: The 4km trail made of wooden planks gives wonderful views of the Vasenieki mire. There is a picnic place in the beginnng and a birdwatching tower along the way.

properties.name: Vecupes taka
properties.txt: A short path that leads to the beach, where you will find picnic tables, a toilet. A scenic place where you can enjoy a peaceful time near the sea.

properties.name: Vedzes dabas taka
properties.txt: A recently renovated, quite wild path in a remote area. A small river, dense forest and even a swamp with a sinkhole can be observed on the way. People with interest in the wilder nature will enjoy this walk.

properties.name: Vekšu taka
properties.txt: This trail is located 2.1km from Zīle settlement, as a continuation of the Zile nature trail. Information boards will teach you about the plants and insects of this area.

properties.name: Velnkalna taka
properties.txt: An old and short trail, made back in 2006. The condition is not good right now. Many bridges and paths are grown into the forest. The trail is not near a road, you have to walk around 500m from the parking place until you can start looking for it (no sign either).

properties.name: Ventspils piekraste
properties.txt: A picnic spot near the sea

properties.name: Ventspils piekraste
properties.txt: A picnic spot near the sea

properties.name: Vesetas purva laipa
properties.txt: Trail located in the area of the Veseta bottomland, mostly made from wooden planks, which barely save you from wet shoes. The trail is quite old and rarely visited, since there exists no sign. Follow our map and you will find this quite interesting place in the middle of nowhere.

properties.name: Viesatas upesloku takas
properties.txt: The Viesata river trail is probably our favorite trail in Latvia. There are several routes you can take, the trail has wonderful picnic places on the way, river views, cliffs, a huge stone and more.

properties.name: Viešūra ezera dabas taka
properties.txt: Trail that leads to the Viesura lake, it doesn't make a circle, so you will have to retrace your walk, totaling 3km. The trail is not in a good condition, but the picnic spot at the beginning is pretty new.

properties.name: Vikmestes taka
properties.txt: A new trail in Sigulda, which starts on the Turaida-Ragana road. There is a hidden parking place on a barely visible road, slow down or you will miss it. It is approximately opposite the Reina ski hill. The trail leads to the Serpentine road and has plenty of beautiful views in any season. Optional detours exist on the way, with possibility to climb the famous Sigulda hills to see the surroundings.

properties.name: Virsaišu ūdenskrituma taka
properties.txt: The 1.7 meters tall Virsaisi waterfall was chosen as the 2010. geologic object of Latvia. The trail is marked with an arrow from the nearby road, and finishes at the waterfall. You can take the road back. There is a picnic site with a table at the waterfall.

properties.name: Vizlas taka
properties.txt: A wonderful walking trail along the Vizla river, beautiful dolomite cliffs. Along the way you can also see a traditional farm, a big stone and a historic arch bridge.

properties.name: Zaķu pļava
properties.txt: The Zaku meadow (literaly, Hare meadow) is located in the Vilce nature park. There are two huge picnic areas with sheltered tables and fire pits. The marked location is also the start of the Counts trail, which leads along the river and is 2.5km  long.

properties.name: Zaķu pļava (aiz muižas pie upes)
properties.txt: On the Hare meadow you can enjoy the cultural history of the local area and drink from the Lielmate spring.

properties.name: Zaķumuižas dabas taka
properties.txt: This childrens learning trail starts in front of a kindergarden and leads along a river, where you will also see the local manor complex and a portion of the forest. The path makes for a nice stroll or a short city getaway. It is located within a populated area, but you will probably not meet many people.

properties.name: Kõrgeperve
properties.txt: RMK camp site. Has a fireplace and an oven, firewood storage, table. A very picturesque place near the river. Access from the river is possible.

properties.name: Lieknas putnu platforma
properties.txt: A birdwatching platform near the Lieknas water reservoirs, a private fish farm. Entrance beyond the lift gate is prohibited, but the view from the platform gives a good overview of the two nearest water bodies and plenty of birds. Herons, swans and even a white tailed eagle can be spotted here. Easy access with a car, nearby house seems abandoned.

properties.name: Cīravas bebru taka
properties.txt: A recently opened trail in the Cirava forest park.

properties.name: Jāņarāmis
properties.txt: A very wide and well equipped camping area near the Gauja river. Made for boaters but accessible from the road. Many tables, firewood, recently renovated. All amenities and free of charge. Recommended

properties.name: Ververu krauja
properties.txt: This location includes a campfire place, some benches, a table and a shelter.

properties.name: Nīcgales Lielais akmens
properties.txt: A shelter, a campfire place and some benches. Located at the Nicgales stone, a geological object of interest.

properties.name: Sudmaļu pilskalns
properties.txt: A campfire place, a table with benches.

properties.name: Vasargelišķu skatu tornis
properties.txt: A beautiful scenic view that was displayed on the 10 LVL banknote. There is a tower and a picnic place.

properties.name: Butišķu loks
properties.txt: A picnic spot with a table, bench, a toilet and a campfire place.

properties.name: Sēra dīķu taka
properties.txt: A pleasant duckboard trail in the Witch bog will lead you in a 2.5km (total) walk to the sulfur pools in the middle of the bog. A recently built trail with a parking space. No other amenities.

properties.name: Atpūtas vieta Nīgrande
properties.txt: Newly built resting place for boaters at the Venta river in Nigrande, near the bridge. Quite open and public, but car has to be parked a little away. Perfect for cyclists and boat travelers.

properties.name: Ormaņkalna tornis
properties.txt: A newly built watchtower in Ormankalns hill. The place is hard to see from the road, so follow our map.

properties.name: Zēņdīķa atpūtas vietas
properties.txt: A pleasant area around an artificial pond, several picnic places with tables, benches and fire pits. Simple parking, a nice boardwalk around the area.

properties.name: Grīviņi
properties.txt: A boat tourist rest place at Gauja river, but accessible by car. Three separated picnic places with fire pits and tables, there is a toilet. A wide and beautiful place for many tents, in a beautiful location.

properties.name: Kulautuvos miško poilsiavietė - Zuikių mokyklėlė Grybai
Lapkalnis
properties.txt: A big space with a swing, toiled, fire pit, covered picnic booth and place for a few tents. Lithuanian state forest managed site

properties.name: Monumentas partizanų kariams - poilsiavietė Žaliu taku
Poilsiavietė Kuktiškių girininkijoje prie Alksno ežero
Poilsiavietė Dubingių girininkijoje prie Kertuojos ežero
Aņņi
properties.txt: Boating rest place with firepit, grill, table and plenty of space for tents, so you can use it even if there are other people staying here. The place has road access and good river access for boating.

properties.name: Rīvas loki
properties.txt: The Rivas river bends trail starts at the Ulmale-Labrags protestant church and leads 3 along the river Riva valley.

properties.name: Ziemassvētku kauju taka
properties.txt: A 7.2 km long walk around the woods where the Christmas war encounters took place in 1916. The Christmas battles took place from December 23 until December 29, 1916

properties.name: Žagare Ozo takas
properties.txt: The Ozo trail first takes you on top of the esker and then leads you around the Žvelgaiču lake.
